question: Panthers vs. Oilers
description:
In the upcoming NHL game, scheduled for June 14 at 8:00PM ET:
If the Florida Panthers win, the market will resolve to “Panthers”.
If the Edmonton Oilers win, the market will resolve to “Oilers”.
If the game is postponed, this market will remain open until the game has been completed.
If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.

question: Will Trump say "America / American" 20+ times during his 250th Army Anniversary remarks on June 14?
description:
Donald Trump is scheduled to participate in a 250th Army Anniversary celebration on June 14. You can read more about that here: https://america250.org/news/the-united-states-of-america-to-honor-the-250th-anniversary-of-the-u-s-army-with-a-grand-military-parade-and-celebration-in-washington-d-c/

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Donald Trump says the listed term during his main speech at this event. Otherwise, the market will resolve to "No".

Any usage of the term regardless of context will count toward the resolution of this market.

Pluralization/possessive of the term will count toward the resolution of this market, however other forms will NOT count.

Instances where the term is used in a compound word will count regardless of context (e.g. joyful is not a compound word for "joy," however "killjoy" is a compounding of the words "kill" and "joy").

This market is explicitly about the main speech that Trump gives in the listed Anniversary event. Speeches, events, or comments that occur outside of this event will not qualify toward this market's resolution.

If Trump does not give a speech at this event, the event is definitively cancelled, or otherwise is not aired by June 14 2025, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source is the video of the event.

Donald Trump is scheduled to participate in a 250th Army Anniversary celebration on June 14. You can read more about that here: https://america250.org/news/the-united-states-of-america-to-honor-the-250th-anniversary-of-the-u-s-army-with-a-grand-military-parade-and-celebration-in-washington-d-c/

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Donald Trump says the listed term during his main speech at this event. Otherwise, the market will resolve to "No".

Any usage of the term regardless of context will count toward the resolution of this market.

Pluralization/possessive of the term will count toward the resolution of this market, however other forms will NOT count.

Instances where the term is used in a compound word will count regardless of context (e.g. joyful is not a compound word for "joy," however "killjoy" is a compounding of the words "kill" and "joy").

This market is explicitly about the main speech that Trump gives in the listed Anniversary event. Speeches, events, or comments that occur outside of this event will not qualify toward this market's resolution.

If Trump does not give a speech at this event, the event is definitively cancelled, or otherwise is not aired by June 14 2025, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source is the video of the event.

question: Will the highest temperature in London be 68°F or below on June 14?
description:
This market will resolve to the temperature range that contains the highest temperature recorded at the London City Airport Station in degrees Fahrenheit on 14 Jun '25.

The resolution source for this market will be information from Wunderground, specifically the highest temperature recorded for all times on this day by the Forecast for the London City Airport Station once information is finalized, available here: https://www.wunderground.com/history/daily/gb/london/EGLC.

This market can not resolve to "Yes" until all data for this date has been finalized.

The resolution source for this market measures temperatures to whole degrees Fahrenheit (eg, 21°F). Thus, this is the level of precision that will be used when resolving the market.

question: Ethereum Up or Down on June 14?
description:
This market will resolve to "Up" if the "Close" price for the Binance 1 minute candle for ETH/USDT 13 Jun '25 12:00 in the ET timezone (noon) is lower than the final "Close" price for the 14 Jun '25 12:00 ET candle.

This market will resolve to "Down" if the "Close" price for the Binance 1 minute candle for ETH/USDT 13 Jun '25 12:00 in the ET timezone (noon) is higher than the final "Close" price for the 14 Jun '25 12:00 ET candle.

If the final "Close" price for both of these candles is exactly equal on Binance, this market will resolve 50-50.

This market will resolve to "Up" if the change for BTC/USDT, measured in percentage, is greater than or equal to 0 for the 1 Hour candle that begins on the time and date specified in the title. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "Down".

The resolution source for this market is information from Binance, specifically the BTC/USDT pair (https://www.binance.com/en/trade/BTC_USDT). The change value displayed at the top of the graph for the relevant "1H" candle will be used once the data for that candle is finalized.

Please note that this market is about the price according to Binance BTC/USDT, not according to other sources or spot markets

For the purposes of this market, a percentage change of -0.00% qualifies as a "Down" resolution.

question: Sky vs Dream
description:
In the upcoming WNBA game, scheduled for June 13 at 7:30PM ET:
If the Chicago Sky win, the market will resolve to "Sky".
If the Atlanta Dream win, the market will resolve to "Dream".
If the game is postponed, this market will remain open until the game has been completed.
If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.

question: Boss Open: Engel vs. Auger-Aliassime
description:
Justin Engel and Felix Auger-Aliassime are scheduled to play each other in a quarterfinals round matchup in the Boss Open mens singles tournament on June 13, 2025, at 5:00 AM ET. 

This market will resolve to “Engel" if Justin Engel advances against Felix Auger-Aliassime in the quarterfinals round of the Boss Open mens singles tournament.

This market will resolve to “Auger-Aliassime" if Felix Auger-Aliassime advances against Justin Engel in the quarterfinals round of the Boss Open mens singles tournament.

If the match ends in a tie, is canceled, or delayed beyond July 13, 2025, this market will resolve to 50-50.

The primary resolution source will be official information from the Boss Open (https://bossopen.com/en/home), however, a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question: Will the price of Bitcoin be less than $106K on June 13 at 5 PM ET?

question: Will Spain win the 2025 UEFA European U21 Championship?
description:
This market will resolve according to the club that wins the 2025 UEFA European Under-21 Championship. 

If at any point it becomes impossible for this team to win the UEFA European Under-21 Championship based on the rules of UEFA (e.g., they are eliminated in the knockout stage), this market will resolve immediately to “No”.

The primary resolution source will be official information from UEFA, however, a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question: Spotify working again by midnight?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if DownDetector (https://downdetector.com/status/spotify/) shows fewer than 100 reported Spotify outages for three consecutive published data points between 3:45 PM and 11:59 PM ET on June 12, 2025. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No."

The resolution source will be DownDetector.

question: Will Adrienne Adams finish third in the 2025 New York City Mayoral Democratic Primary?
description:
This market will resolve to the candidate who finishes third in the 2025 Democratic primary for Mayor of New York City, scheduled for June 24, 2025.

For the purpose of this market, “third place” is defined as the last candidate eliminated before only two candidates remain in the official RCV tabulation. If a candidate wins outright in an early round (by receiving a majority of votes), the third-place finisher will be the candidate with the third-highest final standing in the published elimination order.

If two or more candidates are eliminated simultaneously in the same round, the candidate with the higher vote total at the time of elimination will be considered the higher-placed candidate.

This market will resolve based on the official certified results of the final RCV round as published by the New York City Board of Elections.

If a recount is initiated prior to certification, the market will remain open until the recount is completed and results are certified. A recount initiated after certification will not affect market resolution.

If a candidate wins outright in an early round (by receiving a majority of votes), the third-place finisher will be the candidate with the third-highest final standing in the published elimination order.

If two or more candidates are eliminated simultaneously in the same round, the candidate with the higher vote total at the time of elimination will be considered the higher-placed candidate.

This market will resolve based on the official certified results of the final RCV round as published by the New York City Board of Elections.

If a recount is initiated prior to certification, the market will remain open until the recount is completed and results are certified. A recount initiated after certification will not affect market resolution.

question: First round leader wins NYC Democratic primary?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if the candidate who receives the most first-choice votes in the 2025 Democratic primary for Mayor of New York City, scheduled for June 24, 2025, also finishes with the most votes in the final round of the official ranked-choice voting (RCV) tabulation. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No". 

For the purpose of this market, “first-choice votes” refers to vote totals from the initial round of RCV tabulation, before any eliminations or vote transfers occur. “Final-round votes” refers to the vote totals in the final round of RCV, after all eliminations and reallocation of votes have occurred.

If multiple candidates are tied for the most votes in either the first or final round, the candidate whose last name comes first in alphabetical order will be considered higher-ranked for the purposes of resolving this market.

This market will resolve based on the official certified results published by the New York City Board of Elections. If a recount is initiated before certification, the market will remain open until the recount is completed and results are certified. A recount initiated after certification will not affect market resolution.

question: Will Andrew Cuomo’s RCV margin of victory be greater than 9% in the New York City Mayoral Democratic Primary?
description:
This market will resolve according to the ranked-choice voting (RCV) margin of victory for the listed candidate in the 2025 Democratic primary for Mayor of New York City, scheduled for June 24, 2025.

For the purpose of resolving this market, the “margin of victory” is defined as the absolute percentage-point difference between the final-round vote share received by the listed candidate and the vote share received by the other candidate in the final RCV round. Final-round vote shares will be calculated by dividing each of the final two candidates’ vote totals by the combined total of their votes in that round.

If the reported value falls exactly between two brackets, this market will resolve to the higher range bracket.

If all listed candidates ate eliminated before the final round of RCV tabulation or do not receive the most votes in the final round, this market will resolve to "Other".

This market will resolve based on the official certified results of the final RCV round as published by the New York City Board of Elections.

If a recount is initiated prior to certification, the market will remain open until the recount is completed and results are certified. A recount initiated after certification will not affect market resolution.

question: Israel military action against Iran by Monday?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Israel initiates a military action on Iranian soil, airspace, or maritime territory or against any Iranian embassies or consulates between June 12, and June 16, 2025, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Israel on Iranian soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Iranian soil is hit by an Israeli missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Israeli government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

In the case that the "Yes" resolution criteria are met prior to this market's resolution date, this market will resolve immediately.
